sense.name: a choice, preference, selection
sense.commentary: PICK[+entity][+selection][+preferred] Note: refers to a thing in the world, not the act of deciding (Sense 3) Note: in expressions preceded by 'the' often implies the best of a lot.
sense.examples: Who is your pick for mayor? Take your pick from our extensive selection of colors and styles. The black and white kitten is the pick of the litter. (literally) The teachers considered her the pick of her class. He was the first pick of several teams. This monthly newsletter describes its favorite stock picks.

sense.name: a yield or output of harvested crop
sense.examples: This was the largest peach pick in years. This week the farmers markets are selling their first pick of lettuce.

sense.name: the act of choosing or selecting
sense.examples: John's pick of a restaurant always takes an hour of deliberations. She concluded that Mary's pick of a husband was made in desperation. For the next card trick, Laura can have first pick. (she gets to choose)

sense.name: the woof yarn thread in weaving
sense.examples: In weaving, the pick is woven across the warp yarn. The pick of this fabric is a different color than the warp.

sense.name: a strumming plectrum for a guitar
sense.examples: The guitarist used a pick and a 12-string for the next song. I bought a couple of new guitar picks at the music store.

sense.name: a relatively small hand tool for digging or poking with
sense.examples: Mary broke up the block of ice with an ice pick. Dental hygienists use a pick to remove hard plaque from the teeth.

sense.name: a large, heavy tool for breaking, striking
sense.examples: They used picks and sledges to break up the big rocks. John swung the pick over his shoulder and brought it down on the concrete.

sense.name: a maneuver in basketball
sense.examples: He was called for setting an illegal pick.

sense.name: a wide-toothed comb
sense.examples: The stylist used a pick to comb out Mary's new perm. Sally bought a set of hair picks at the drugstore.

sense.name: a forepart point on a figure skate
sense.examples: The skaters form their figures with the picks of their skate blades.

sense.name: a blow or strike with a pointed implement
sense.examples: He opened the can with a sharp pick to the lid. The bird cracked open the nut with small successive picks to the shell.
